## Coaching

### Reading Royals - Head Coach

#### Wins / Losses

```{python, echo=false}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Data for the pie chart
wins = 55
losses = 44
ot_losses = 10
total_games = wins + losses + ot_losses

# Labels and sizes for the pie chart
labels = ['Wins', 'Losses', 'Overtime Losses']
sizes = [wins, losses, ot_losses]
colors = ['#77379A', '#AAB2B9', '#FF9800']  # Green, Red, Orange for the slices

# Plot the pie chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', colors=colors, startangle=90, wedgeprops={'edgecolor': 'black'})

# Title of the pie chart
ax.set_title('')

# Set background color to transparent for the figure and axes
fig.patch.set_facecolor('none')   # Remove figure background color
ax.set_facecolor('none')          # Remove axes background color


# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie chart is drawn as a circle.
ax.axis('equal')

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```
